sentences.english: Even with perfect viewing conditions, the lights are notoriously hit or miss.
sentences.chinese: 儘管天氣條件很好，北極光卻是來無影去無蹤。

sentences.english: Also sometimes we ca powerful see the " North Pole light" .
sentences.chinese: 同時還有極晝極夜景象並且有時能看到北極光。

sentences.english: The aurora borealis over mountains in Ulsfjord, Norway.
sentences.chinese: 該圖所示的是攝於挪威烏爾斯約德山上的北極光。

sentences.english: And don't let the aurora borealis fool you.
sentences.chinese: 所以不要被北極光給矇蔽了雙眼。

sentences.english: Aurora Borealis (Northern Lights) colours the night sky through a silhouetted forest.
sentences.chinese: 北極光染紅了夜空，透出了森林的輪廓。

sentences.english: Deng Feng of aurora borealis copartner thinks.
sentences.chinese: 北極光合夥人鄧峯認爲。

sentences.english: Long streamers of Northern Lights flashing blue wisps across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 北極光的狹長流光，閃射出藍色的光芒，橫過夜空。

sentences.english: Elegant rhodium-plated, open-work sphere clip earrings set with Aurora Borealis crystals.
sentences.chinese: 優雅的鍍銠，開放式的夾式耳環配北極光水晶。

sentences.english: To see the northern lights requires patience and good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 要看到北極光需要耐心和好運氣。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated Aurora Borealis crystal drop pierced earrings.
sentences.chinese: 銠鍍北極光晶體下降鑽耳環。

sentences.english: Seeing the northern lights for the first time is a thing of wonder.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到北極光是一件驚奇的事。

sentences.english: The aurora borealis might be the greatest show on earth.
sentences.chinese: 北極光也許是地球上最偉大的表演。

sentences.english: Rays of “Aurora Borealis” It looks spectacular in the skies of Alaska.
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加的上空看到的北極光是很壯觀的。

sentences.english: At 10.30 pm we'll leave for the third night of aurora viewing.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10點半出發，第三次出去觀賞北極光。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated hair clip with two bezel-set, star-shaped Aurora Borealis crystals.
sentences.chinese: 銠鍍頭髮剪輯兩個邊框集，星型北極光晶體。

sentences.english: It was like nothing so much as the phantasmagoric play of the northern lights.
sentences.chinese: 這和北極光的變幻不定極其相似。

definition: a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
